title.native: ハイキュー!! TO THE TOP

description:
The fourth season of Haikyuu!!

The Karasuno High School Volleyball Club finally won their way into the nationals after an intense battle for the Miyagi Prefecture Spring Tournament qualifiers. As they were preparing for the nationals, Kageyama is invited to go to All-Japan Youth Training Camp. At the same time, Tsukishima is invited to go to a special rookie select training camp for first-years in Miyagi Prefecture. Hinata feels panic that he’s being left behind as one of the first-years and then decides to show up at the Miyagi Prefecture rookie select training camp anyway...

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: ไฮคิว!! คู่ตบฟ้าประทาน ภาค 4 Part 1

node.description:
Furudate's first published work was King Kid (2008), which won an honorable mention on the 14th Jump Treasure Newcomer Manga Prize.
Up to date, their gender is unknown and it hasn't been revealed whether 'Haruichi Furudate' is a pen name or not. However, it's a ​popular belief among the Japanese fans that Haruichi Furudate is actually a woman.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋英樹_(アニメーター%29)

Took part as a key animator on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [actor](https://anilist.co/staff/111553/) or the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/110065/)._

__[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako). The guitarist [Oji](https://anilist.co/staff/148135) (Kaizoku Ou), the illustrators Rocoru (in 2013) and [Mogelatte](https://anilist.co/staff/121589/Mogelatte), the video producer Ziro and the pianist [cake](https://anilist.co/staff/147555) (the latter three joining in May 2014) are also part of the group as support members. Later on they acquired the drummer Nakanishi in 2017. However, Rocoru graduated from the group in 2019. Some of their most popular songs include "Suki Kirai", "Hatsukoi no Ehon" and "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu". Their music style consists mostly of positive rocky songs. In January 2014 they had their first major debut, with the album "Zutto Maekara Suki Deshita.", which ranked in fourth place on Oricon. In May 2014, the start-up of "CHiCO with HoneyWorks" was announced. Sometime in early 2019, the circle began to include subunits: s×c, a duo comprised of shito and cake; and HoneyMonster, comprised of Gom (Kouto), cake, and Nakanishi. The circle also created a number of fictional idols, such as LIP×LIP and Dolce. In addition, ten light novels, based on the Confession Executive Committee Love Series songs "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu", "Yakimochi no Kotae", "Hatsukoi no Ehon", "Ima ni Suki Naru.", "Koi-Iro ni Sake", "Kinyoubi no Ohayou", "Heart no Shuchou", "Ijiwaru na Deai", "Boku ga Namae wo Yobu Hi", and "Daikirai na Hazu Datta." have been released so far. A short novella about the song "Watashi, Idol Sengen" was also included with a CHiCO with Honeyworks album. Light novels for HoneyWorks' other songs do exist as well; the Love and Hate Trilogy ("Nakimushi Kareshi", "Suki-Kirai", "Hajimari no Sayonara") and "Sekai wa Koi ni Ochiteiru" and its sequel "Koi no Chord" both received one.

__Website | Twitter__ Birth: CHiCO's year of birth and any further information of her early life is currently unknown or not publicly revealed. Her birth was privately held, and only shown to be on a January 27. Biography: CHiCO is a female japanese singer that is currently under the label: MusicRay'n Inc. While growing up CHiCO was very interested in anison (a term used to abbreviate Anime song, but is also used generally when referring to anime music that has a focus on opening and ending theme songs). Upon entering high school she was introduced to a voice training teacher by an acquaintance she knew at the time, this pushed her to become a professional singer. In the summer of 2013, CHiCO entered the national singer audition "Utakatsu!" (specializing in "Anison" and "Vocaloid") hosted by Sony Music Entertainment SD Group. She won the grand prize at the contest, which led to a decision to collaborate with the creator group "[HoneyWorks](https://anilist.co/staff/146863/HoneyWorks)". On the 6th of August, 2014, CHiCO debuted with the opening theme song for the anime "Ao Haru Ride" named "Sekai wa Koi Ni Ochiteiru" under the guise of "CHiCO with HoneyWorks". This was her official debut as a singer. On the 18th of November, 2015, CHiCO together with HoneyWorks released their first album named "Sekai Ha i Ni Michiteiru". This was CHiCO's first ever album release, and the album sold 24,000 copies during its first week of sale.

name.native: バーンアウトシンドロームズ

node.description:
__[Website](http://burnoutsyndromes.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/burnout_live) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCXos4VWtLz_TNjLZy6F8mdw)__

__Introduction:__
BURNOUT SYNDROMES is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record label EPIC Records Japan (2016–), affiliated with the entertainment agency Handmade Music. 

__Biography:__
The band initially formed in 2005, due to Taiyu being heavily influenced by his brother to start a band. He would first invite Kazuumi, who went to the same school as Taiyu, then he invited Takuya, who was an avid player of drum mania at the local game center. This trio would eventually become the BURNOUT SYNDROMES as we know today.

__Members:__
- [Kazuumi Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/149247) (熊谷和海) – vocalist, guitarist, in-charge of lyrics and composition
- Taiyu Ishikawa (石川大裕) – bassist, chorus, M&C
- Takuya Hirose (廣瀬拓哉) – drummer, chorus
__Yumiko Nakata__ is a Japanese director of photography, photographer and special effects artist.

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)
__Hiromi Kikuta__ is a Japanese sound director, who works for the company Rakuonsha.

__[Profile (Legendoor)](http://www.legendoor.com/artist/%E6%A9%98%E9%BA%BB%E7%BE%8E)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/AsamiTachibana)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/achaamiii/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/caffemocha0428)__

A Japanese pianist, composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor.

Kozue Kananiwa graduated from the HOSEI University of Tokyo, Faculty of Letters, Department of Japan Literature. Her first work as a producer was for [Oh! My Goddess](https://anilist.co/anime/50/Aa-Megamisama-TV/) in 2005.

Since, she participated in the production many renown series such as [Mahou Shoujo Madoka☆Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Mahou-Shoujo-MadokaMagica/) in 2011, [Steins;Gate](https://anilist.co/anime/9253/SteinsGate) the same year, or more recently [Horimiya](https://anilist.co/anime/124080/Horimiya/).

Now, she is the General Manager of  both U-NEXT Anime & Book Division and of the Production Department.

(Source : Bangumi 番組計画RC3)

__Katsuji Morishita__ is a Japanese animation planner and producer. He works for studio Production I.G.

CEO of Signal M.D which is one of Production I.G's subsidiaries

Hiroo Maruyama is a producer working for Mainichi Broadcasting System (MBS).

He joined Mainichi Broadcasting in 1999. Was transferred later to the Tokyo office and took over duties relating to the production of animation broadcasts. He was responsible for production on series like Gundam Seed, Gundam Seed Destiny and Full Metal Alchemist, all part of the 6:00pm Saturday timeblock, which gained wide popularity.
**Akito Takahashi** is a publicity producer working for Toho.
